Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Kitty \Kit"ty\, n. 1. A kitten; also, a pet name or calling name for the cat. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
2. [Etym. uncertain.] (Gaming) The percentage taken out of a pool to pay for refreshments, or for the expenses of the table; by extension, any pool of money aggregated from small contributions. --R. F. Foster. [Webster 1913 Suppl. +PJC]

kitty n 1: the combined stakes of the betters [syn: {pool}] 2: the cumulative amount involved in a game (such as poker) [syn: {pot}, {jackpot}] 3: young domestic cat [syn: {kitten}] 4: informal terms referring to a domestic cat [syn: {kitty-cat}, {puss}, {pussy}, {pussycat}]
